comment: I love this class and the professor! He is very nice and is willing to work with you if you need extra help. He very engaging and definitely makes you want to come to class. Just make sure to attend class. You'll miss minor things that will help you with the practical.  Definitely would take him again!

Over all this is a nice class and the chef is so cool and fun! However I wouldn't recommend taking this class if your looking for an easy "A" or as just a "fun elective". There is a Nationalized Test that is difficult and must be passed in order to pass the class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Chef is very knowledgable and passionate about his material. His quizzes are difficult, but manageable.  This class was a lot of work, but  he is understanding and will help you with difficult situations. If you get the chance, take his class. you won't regret it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great guy, super funny, amazing chef. Weekly quizzes that weren't always over what they said they would be. It's a good class but if you have a tough semester and are looking for an easy elective, this is not it. I did learn a lot about cooking, but I felt like the reading and quizzes were harder than necessary. But he is absolutely awesome!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Great Professor overall. He is patient and wants his students to learn. Weekly quizzes so be prepared.

He's the best teacher I've had!! He's so funny and sweet and patient. 10/10 recommend. You do have to take quizzes weekly out of class but they aren't bad and since you cook every week attendance is mandatory if you want to pass the class! Loved him!!!
Overall good chef/professor. High expectations but will work with you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Awesome class to take!  He is a great professor,  he listens and cares to learn about you and what you like in food. Labs were fun everyday, and as a class we enjoyed the competition of outdoing each other with our recipes. Show up and dress up for lab every class appropriately (apron, ksu shirt, black pants, non slip shoes)  and you'll enjoy class

Awesome teacher! he is very helpful, funny, and understanding. He makes the class easy. Be prepared to work in groups. We all help clean the kitchen afterwards so if you leave before hand, he will be pissed at you.  The best part was doing the live lobster project.

Chef Stuart is awesome! Class is easy and fun, obviously you have to be there because you're baking but it's so worth it. Plus he makes side meals for the class to sample. He's helpful, easy going, and knows what he's doing. He likes to joke around too. Because it's baking there's no reading and only two tests. Great class highly recommend him!

This professor is a great dude. He makes class fun, and helps you out the entire way. He's pretty funny and easy going. He wants this classes to be fun, and he wants you to learn from them. If you have the choice, pick him. You'll have a great semester if you do.

Chef Stuart is awesome! First time teaching baking. He's super nice and really cares for his students. The ONLY criticism I have about the class is sometimes he would give us 4-5 things to bake in one class, and it got a little bit hectic and we didn't always finish on time. If you love baking/cooking, take his class! He's a wonderful professor.

CSH 2300 (05) - Basic Culinary Skills. Chef Stu is one of the best instructors I have ever had. He is an expert on the subject matter, is very passionate about sharing his knowledge, has a good sense of humor and shows great empathy towards his students. This class provides useful, life-long knowledge for Culinary majors and non-majors.

Amazing professor!!! I didn't really know anything about cooking before this class and I learned a lot plus he's super helpful and funny! You definitely need to read the textbook if you want to do good on the weekly online quizzes and the final. Don't skip class!! Definitely would take him again.

Chef  is a down-to-earth guy who will give you all the tools you need to pass this Basic Culinary class. Pay attention and go to class, because he will show you all you need to pass the final. He is there for you, so use that as an opportunity. He is a really nice guy. You will need to read your textbook to pass written tests.
